intro: Dimeria deccanensis, commonly known as the Deccan dimeria, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid regions of southern India. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
